summary: a paramyxovirus characterized by fever, malaise, cough, coryza conjunctivitis, a maculopapular rash is known to result in pneumonia, encephalitis and death. in 2013–2014, 4690 cases were reported and the majority were children less than 1 year of age. at least a 3–5 day delay in diagnosis was observed. sporadic adult cases and their virologic surveillance and molecular epidemiology will be important to interrupt transmission.
